intro: Pomphidea swartziana, commonly known as the Swartz's pompholyx, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
